Posted By: pedrodyl (9/28/2012 9:08:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: At first it may look like a weaker version of Frost Titan, but detaining is much more powerful than tapping. Detain locks abilities which don't require their source to tap, and you can't get rid of detain, while you can untap your pernaments with various means. This is powerful guy for it's guild. Don't forget what's all guild about... I love Azorius! :)
posts.html:
At first it may look like a weaker version of Frost Titan, but detaining is much more powerful than tapping. Detain locks abilities which don't require their source to tap, and you can't get rid of detain, while you can untap your pernaments with various means. This is powerful guy for it's guild. Don't forget what's all guild about... I love Azorius! :)

Posted By: Narim (9/26/2012 1:22:09 AM)
Rating:

@majinara : You make valid points. However, I feel that comparing this card to a titan is unfair. Not only are those titans mythic creatures, but they were part of the very strong mythic categories that just pushes powercreep to the limit. If we look at this card pre/post titan-level-mythics era, it's actually quite worth it for it's cost.
Although I tend to agree that it costing 7 is too much, the detain ability is new and seems quite strong, so if this card would've only costed 6, maybe it would've been a problem. It's quite hard to tell.
4/5 for me

Posted By: Lundaling (1/24/2013 8:21:38 PM)

posts.post_content:
@Tsuichoi, it says "nonland", so it's not quite *any* permanent. Still, by the time you have this out, you probably have better choices for targets than lands, anyway.  
  
Note also that your opponent will have a window of opportunity to use abilities, during your turn before you attack. So it's not a complete lockdown, though it will prevent sorcery-speed effects and combat tricks.
posts.html:
@Tsuichoi, it says "nonland", so it's not quite any permanent. Still, by the time you have this out, you probably have better choices for targets than lands, anyway.

Note also that your opponent will have a window of opportunity to use abilities, during your turn before you attack. So it's not a complete lockdown, though it will prevent sorcery-speed effects and combat tricks.

Posted By: SuitofArmor (12/31/2012 3:21:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*So nice, i'll detain 'em twice*  
  
But seriously the real clause to note is its any permanent- Your opponents lands, his creatures, his [Birthing Pod](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birthing Pod), his [Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver)... and in EDH, hes not locked down till end of turn, but has to wait all the way until YOU have your turn.   
  
On a flavor note, i wonder what that Triumvirate is, perhaps it is an organization within the Azorius of bureaucratic importance which will be detailed later on, or even receive the honor of its own card- One can hope.   
  
A welcomed and amazing addition to the might of the Azorius.   
  
4.5/5

posts.post_content:
I run two of these in my Azorius detain and sky attack deck. When he hits the table, if the opponent doesn't have a removal spell in hand, it's game over. Keep a counter spell, dissipate, syncopate in your hand for the win....  
  
In a control deck, 7 mana for his double detain ability is not too much at all. This guy see's play almost every game I draw him in.
